dict.string: Extract renamed macro groups from the database
SELECT gro.Group_Name, grn.Group_Name FROM groups_new grn JOIN groups_old gro ON grn.Group_ID = gro.Group_ID WHERE grn.Group_Name <> gro.Group_Name
Do some update and labeling work on matches
Set the status of the renamed groups in the database
UPDATE groups_new SET Group_Status = 'renamed' WHERE Group_ID IN ( SELECT gro.Group_ID FROM groups_old gro WHERE groups_new.Group_Name <> gro.Group_Name );
Set the status of the macros in the renamed group in the database

UPDATE macros_new SET Macro_Status = 'grouprenamed' WHERE Group_ID IN ( SELECT gro.Group_ID FROM groups_new grn JOIN groups_old gro ON grn.Group_ID = gro.Group_ID WHERE grn.Group_Name <> gro.Group_Name );

array.string: Set status of renamed macros within renamed groups

dict.string: If Finder labels enabled, label the matches
Empty macro groups have UUIDs but don't exist in Finder, so skip them
Extract renamed macros from the database
SELECT mn.Group_Name, mo.Macro_Name, mn.Macro_Name FROM macros_new mn join macros_old mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID WHERE mn.Macro_Name <> mo.Macro_Name AND mn.Group_ID = mo.Group_ID
Update datatbase if there were matches
Set the status of the renamed macros in the database
UPDATE macros_new SET Macro_Status = 'renamed' WHERE Macro_ID IN ( SELECT mo.Macro_ID FROM macros_old mo WHERE macros_new.Macro_Name <> mo.Macro_Name );
Set the status of the groups containing the renamed macros in the database
UPDATE groups_new SET Group_Status = 'modified' WHERE Group_ID IN ( SELECT mn.Group_ID FROM macros_new mn WHERE mn.Macro_Status = 'renamed' );

array.string: Set the status of groups containing renamed macros

dict.string: Extract renamed macros and update database
Extract moved macros from the database
SELECT mn.Macro_Name, mo.Group_Name, mn.Group_Name FROM macros_new mn JOIN macros_old mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID AND mn.Macro_Name = mo.Macro_Name WHERE mn.Group_ID <> mo.Group_ID
Set the status of the moved macros in the database
Set the status of the moved macros in the database

UPDATE macros_new SET Macro_Status = 'moved' WHERE Macro_ID IN ( SELECT mo.Macro_ID FROM macros_new AS mn JOIN macros_old AS mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID WHERE mn.Macro_Name = mo.Macro_Name AND mn.Group_ID <> mo.Group_ID );
Set the status of the groups containing the moved macros in the database

UPDATE groups_new SET Group_Status = 'modified' WHERE Group_ID IN ( SELECT DISTINCT mn.Group_ID FROM macros_new mn JOIN macros_old mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID AND mn.Macro_Name = mo.Macro_Name WHERE mn.Group_ID <> mo.Group_ID );

array.string: Set status of groups containing moved macros

dict.string: Extract moved macros and update database
Find and label all moved and renamed macros
Extract all moved and renamed macros from the database

SELECT mo.Macro_Name, mn.Macro_Name, mo.Group_Name, mn.Group_Name FROM macros_new mn JOIN macros_old mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID AND mn.Macro_Name <> mo.Macro_Name WHERE mn.Group_ID <> mo.Group_ID

array.string: Extract all renamed and moved macros

dict.string: Update datatbase if there were matches
Set the status of the moved and renamed macros in the database

UPDATE macros_new SET Macro_Status = 'movedrenamed' WHERE Macro_ID IN ( SELECT mo.Macro_ID FROM macros_new AS mn JOIN macros_old AS mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID WHERE mn.Macro_Name <> mo.Macro_Name AND mn.Group_ID <> mo.Group_ID );

array.string: Set status of moved and renamed macros

dict.string: Set the status of the groups containing the moved and renamed macros in the database

UPDATE groups_new SET Group_Status = 'modified' WHERE Group_ID IN ( SELECT DISTINCT mn.Group_ID FROM macros_new mn JOIN macros_old mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID AND mn.Macro_Name <> mo.Macro_Name WHERE mn.Group_ID <> mo.Group_ID );

array.string: Set status of groups containing moved and renamed macros

dict.string: Extract moved-and-renamed macros and update database
